commands.name: az monitor pipeline-group create
commands.syntax:
az monitor pipeline-group create --name
                                 --resource-group
                                 [--exporters]
                                 [--extended-location]
                                 [--location]
                                 [--network-config]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--processors]
                                 [--receivers]
                                 [--replicas]
                                 [--service]
                                 [--tags]
examples: az monitor pipeline-group create --resource-group myResourceGroup --pipeline-group-name plGroup1 --location eastus2 --extended-location "{name:/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourcegroups/myResourceGroup/providers/microsoft.extendedlocation/customlocations/myTestCustomLocation,type:CustomLocation}" --tags "{tag1:A,tag2:B}" --receivers "[{type:UDP,name:udp-receiver1,udp:{endpoint:'0.0.0.0:518',encoding:utf-8}}]" --processors "[]" --exporters "[{type:AzureMonitorWorkspaceLogs,name:my-workspace-logs-exporter1,azure-monitor-workspace-logs:{api:{data-collection-endpoint-url:'https://logs-myingestion-eb0s.eastus-1.ingest.monitor.azure.com',stream:Custom-MyTableRawData_CL,data-collection-rule:dcr-00000000000000000000000000000000,schema:{record-map:[{from:body,to:Body},{from:severity_text,to:SeverityText},{from:time_unix_nano,to:TimeGenerated}]}},concurrency:{worker-count:4,batch-queue-size:100}}}]" --service "{pipelines:[{name:MyPipelineForLogs1,type:logs,receivers:[udp-receiver1],processors:[],exporters:[my-workspace-logs-exporter1]}]}"

commands.name: az monitor pipeline-group delete
commands.syntax:
az monitor pipeline-group delete [--ids]
                                 [--name]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--resource-group]
                                 [--subscription]
                                 [--yes]

commands.name: az monitor pipeline-group list
commands.summary: List all workspaces in the specified subscription.

commands.name: az monitor pipeline-group show
commands.summary: Get the specific pipeline group instance.

commands.name: az monitor pipeline-group update
commands.syntax:
az monitor pipeline-group update [--add]
                                 [--exporters]
                                 [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--ids]
                                 [--name]
                                 [--network-config]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--processors]
                                 [--receivers]
                                 [--remove]
                                 [--replicas]
                                 [--resource-group]
                                 [--service]
                                 [--set]
                                 [--subscription]
                                 [--tags]
examples: az monitor pipeline-group update --resource-group myResourceGroup --pipeline-group-name plGroup1 --receivers "[{type:UDP,name:udp-receiver1,udp:{endpoint:'0.0.0.0:518',encoding:utf-8}}]" --processors "[]" --exporters "[{type:AzureMonitorWorkspaceLogs,name:my-workspace-logs-exporter1,azure-monitor-workspace-logs:{api:{data-collection-endpoint-url:'https://logs-myingestion-eb0s.eastus-1.ingest.monitor.azure.com',stream:Custom-MyTableRawData_CL,data-collection-rule:dcr-00000000000000000000000000000000,schema:{record-map:[{from:body,to:Body},{from:severity_text,to:SeverityText},{from:time_unix_nano,to:TimeGenerated}]}},concurrency:{worker-count:4,batch-queue-size:100}}}]" --service "{pipelines:[{name:MyPipelineForLogs1,type:logs,receivers:[udp-receiver1],processors:[],exporters:[my-workspace-logs-exporter1]}]}"

commands.name: az monitor pipeline-group wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
